titleStmt.title: John Boyle to Green Clay Smith
CWG14130

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Assistant Adjutant General Letter Book - No. 1 ; 5 Sept 1863 - 2 Feb 1864

body.p:
31
Frankfort, Septr. 19. 1863.
Genl. G. Clay Smith,
Covington

I am directed by the Governor to say the privilege of transferring Capt. Dyas Company to the three years service is granted, they being willing to such transfer, your order can furnish subsistence &c.

John Boyle
Adjt Genl Ky Vols
by Chas Haydon. Clerk

Frankfort Sept. 19. 1863.
Capt. Dyas or S. F. Swope.
Falmouth
See Genl. G. Clay Smith ^at Covington^ in relation to subsistence arms &c.

John Boyle
Adjt Genl Ky Vols
By Chas Haydon Clerk
